iterations.decoded_message:
The Q4 2024 product roadmap update includes the following key points: 

We are currently 65% complete with our SOC 2 certification. 
8.3% of our users are on iOS 17.2+, and we have spent 3 weeks on development. 
Our customer satisfaction scores have dropped to 3.1/5.0, with 2,847 open tickets and an average response time of 18 hours. 
Notably, our numbers are 340% higher than target. 
We have 12,000 enterprise users.

In terms of costs, we have incurred $75K in AWS migration costs and $325K in additional headcount costs. 
We are also spending $12,000 per month on redundant infrastructure and $45,000 on contractor costs. 
A proposed budget of $450,000 has been outlined.

To address these challenges, we plan to hire 2 additional contractors for 6 weeks, upgrade to SDWebImage 5.18, and hire 5 additional support engineers. 
A remediation plan and hotfix approach will be implemented, along with cost monitoring and optimization strategies.

iterations.decoded_message:
The Q4 2024 product roadmap update includes several key items. We have 8 medium-severity findings from the security audit. The customer support ticket backlog currently stands at 2,847 open tickets, with an average response time of 18 hours. This has resulted in customer satisfaction scores dropping to 3.1/5.0. 

Regarding our data warehouse, we have successfully migrated 23 out of 47 pipelines to Snowflake. The authentication service migration is also underway. Our mobile app is experiencing performance issues, particularly with 8.3% of users on iOS 17.2+. 

Development time for these initiatives is estimated at 3 weeks. We have seen a 340% increase in a key metric, higher than our target. Our enterprise user base consists of 12,000 users.

Costs associated with these efforts include $75K in AWS migration costs, $325K in additional headcount costs, and $12,000 per month in redundant infrastructure. We have also incurred $45,000 in contractor costs.

To address these challenges, we plan to hire 5 additional support engineers and engage 2 additional contractors for 6 weeks. We will also implement a remediation plan and a hotfix approach, including an upgrade to SDWebImage 5.18.

iterations.decoded_message:
The Q4 2024 product roadmap update includes several key initiatives. We are addressing security audit findings, which have identified 8 medium-severity and 2 high-severity findings. The customer support ticket backlog currently stands at 2,847 open tickets, with an average response time of 18 hours, resulting in customer satisfaction scores dropping to 3.1/5.0.

We are also working on the data warehouse migration to Snowflake, with 23 pipelines successfully migrated out of 47, representing 65% completion. Additionally, the authentication service migration and session management layer issues are being addressed.

The mobile app is experiencing performance issues due to an outdated SDWebImage library, a memory leak in the image caching layer, and a Redis cluster configuration issue. Specifically, 8.3% of users are on iOS 17.2+, and the app's issues are being prioritized.

To address these challenges, we will be hiring 5 additional support engineers and engaging 2 additional contractors for 6 weeks. We will also be upgrading to SDWebImage 5.18 and implementing a hotfix approach. The data warehouse migration to Snowflake has required 3 weeks of development time.

Our current user base consists of 12,000 enterprise users. The migration to Snowflake has resulted in a 340% increase in a key metric, although the specific details of this increase are not provided.

The costs associated with these initiatives include $75K in AWS migration costs, $325K in additional headcount costs, $12,000 per month in redundant infrastructure, and $45,000 in contractor costs.

iterations.decoded_message:
Our Q4 2024 product roadmap update includes several key initiatives. We have 450,000 consumer accounts and 12,000 enterprise users, with 8.3% of users on iOS 17.2+. 

Regarding our current status, we have 2,847 open customer support tickets, with an average response time of 18 hours, resulting in customer satisfaction scores dropping to 3.1/5.0. Our security audit findings include 2 high-severity and 8 medium-severity findings, with issues such as an outdated SDWebImage library, insufficient access logging, lack of automated security scanning, a memory leak in the image caching layer, and a Redis cluster configuration issue.

We are in the process of migrating our data warehouse to Snowflake, with 23 out of 47 pipelines successfully migrated, representing 65% completion. The authentication service migration and addressing mobile app performance issues are also underway. Additionally, we are working towards SOC 2 certification.

Our recent AWS bill for October was $287,000. We have identified areas for cost optimization, including $12,000 per month in redundant infrastructure. The migration to Snowflake is expected to incur $75,000 in AWS migration costs, while hiring additional support engineers will require $325,000 in headcount costs. We have also allocated $45,000 for contractor costs.

To address our current challenges, we plan to hire 5 additional support engineers and engage 2 additional contractors for 6 weeks. We will also upgrade to SDWebImage 5.18 and implement a remediation plan, utilizing a hotfix approach where necessary. These initiatives will require 3 weeks of development time. Our customer support ticket backlog and security audit findings will be prioritized, with the goal of improving customer satisfaction scores and enhancing our overall security posture.

iterations.decoded_message:
Our Q4 2024 product roadmap update includes several key initiatives. We have 450,000 consumer accounts and 12,000 enterprise users, with 8.3% of users on iOS 17.2+. 

Regarding our current status, we have completed 65% of our data warehouse migration to Snowflake, with 23 pipelines successfully migrated out of 47. However, our customer support ticket backlog stands at 2,847 open tickets, with an average response time of 18 hours and customer satisfaction scores at 3.1/5.0.

Our security audit findings include 2 high-severity and 8 medium-severity findings, with issues such as an outdated SDWebImage library, insufficient access logging, lack of automated security scanning, a memory leak in the image caching layer, and a Redis cluster configuration issue.

We are also addressing mobile app performance issues and session management layer issues. Our authentication service migration is underway. Additionally, we are working towards SOC 2 certification.

In terms of costs, our AWS bill for October was $287,000. We have incurred costs of $75,000 in AWS migration costs and anticipate $325,000 in additional headcount costs. We are also paying $12,000 per month in redundant infrastructure costs and $45,000 in contractor costs.

To remediate our current issues, we plan to hire 5 additional support engineers and engage 2 additional contractors for 6 weeks. We will also upgrade to SDWebImage 5.18 and implement a hotfix approach. These initiatives require 3 weeks of development time.
